note.p: Education: University College, London. PhD (1855, Heidelberg)

Career: Demonstrator of Chemistry, Owen's College, Manchester (1851-1853); worked under Bunsen in Heidelberg; Assistant to Alexander Williamson (FRS 1855), at University College, London (1857); Professor of Natural Philosophy, Bedford College, London (1860-1870); Lecturer in Chemistry, Medical School, St Mary's Hospital, London (1868-1870); Lecturer in Chemistry, Medical School, St Bartholomew's Hospital, London (1870-1897); co-founder of the Institute of Chemistry (President 1894-1897)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1910-1911 vol 84 pp xxx-xxxi signed by G C F
